title: Lioness Chloe Kelly flaunts her figure in a tiny Burberry triangle bikini as she takes a well deserved break in Ibiza with boyfriend Scott after the Women World Cup
body_text:
Lioness Chloe Kelly flaunts her figure in a tiny Burberry triangle bikini as she takes a well deserved break in Ibiza with boyfriend Scott after the Women's World Cup
She's recently returned from Australia after the Women's World Cup.
And Chloe Kelly took to Instagram on Friday to share some snaps whilst vacationing in Ibiza for a well deserved holiday.
The 25-year-old donned a tiny triangle Burberry bikini with a cream, black and white tartan print styled with a pair of high waisted crochet cream trousers.
The footballer accessorised with a pair of black platform sliders and a pair of oversized sunglasses.
In another selfie Chloe has tucked her blonde locks behind her ears exposing a delicate pair of hoop earrings.
R&R: Chloe Kelly took to Instagram on Friday to share some snaps whilst vacationing in Ibiza for a well deserved holiday
Selfie: The 25-year-old donned a tiny triangle bikini with a cream, black and white tartan print styled with a pair of high waisted crochet cream trousers
Scott, Chloe's boyfriend of three years, wore a casual ensemble with a pair of blue swimming trunks, a white Moncler T-shirt and white trainers.
Chloe captioned the Instagram post 'much needed R&R time' with a range of emojis including the sun, palm tree and a white heart.
After being in Australia for nine weeks, Chloe returned to Heathrow Airport on Tuesday alongside the rest of the team.
She took to Instagram when she returned and shared an adorable picture of herself and two dogs having cuddles in the garden.
Chloe captions the Instagram story 'back with my boys'.
Around 40 fans including children had gathered at Terminal 3 early Tuesday morning in the hope of meeting the footballers and giving them a rousing welcome home.
However the decision was made for the England players to leave Heathrow via a private exit which left many young fans disappointed after waiting hours to greet them.
Officials added that they had asked Heathrow to inform its staff to tell any fans arriving that the players would not be coming through the main arrivals exit.
Pose: Chloe captioned the Instagram post 'much needed R&R time' with a range of emojis including the sun, palm tree and a white heart
Doggy daycare: Chloe posted a picture on Instagram of her with her dogs, saying: 'Back with my boys'
Coming home: England football fans await the arrival of the women's team at London Heathrow Airport on Tuesday
Battle: England's Chloe under pressure from Spain's Olga Carmona during the FIFA Women's World Cup final
It is not clear whether this message was relayed to any of the supporters gathered in Terminal 3 overnight
A source also said there would be a chance to celebrate the Lionesses at their next home match, against Scotland at Sunderland's Stadium of Light on September 22.
It is not yet clear whether any event to commemorate their run to the final will be held before then.
Some fans brought flowers for Wiegman, while others held placards featuring messages saying 'You all made us proud' and 'Can we have two T-shirts please?'.
Hopes were raised when former England player Alex Scott, who had been leading the BBC's coverage, was spotted walking through arrivals. Fans said she hinted the team would follow - and the crowd burst out into chants of 'Sweet Caroline'.
